thread.title: Eggbro—An Innovative, New Product That Produces Delicious Golden Eggs
thread.title_full: Eggbro—An Innovative, New Product That Produces Delicious Golden Eggs

author: prbuzz.com
title: Eggbro—An Innovative, New Product That Produces Delicious Golden Eggs
text:
Automatically and perfectly mix the egg white and the egg yolk together inside of the shell
NEW YORK, New York—August 26, 2015—The Eggbro, an innovative, new product has just been announced. Eggbro is a unique and remarkable machine that can mix the egg white and the yolk perfectly together in the shell, forming a different type of egg—a golden egg. Easily operated and fully automatic, this product can be used with almost all sizes of chicken eggs. Since there is no longer the need to break the shell when mixing egg white and egg yolk, Eggbro brings some unprecedented advantages to the table. These advantages include dish washing reduced, saving time, and delicious golden eggs.
With the Eggbro, add the golden egg into your next salad, guests will be delighted by this alternative but classic dish! It’s simple, just open the lid, place the egg firmly inside the holder, close the lid, press the button, and in one minute open the lid and pull out the golden egg. However, before everyone can use this innovative product, Eggbro needs help. That’s why they launched this Kickstarter campaign . The goal of this project is to raise $100,000 by September 15, 2015. The funds raised will go toward production and manufacturing.
To help bring this innovative product, please visit the Kickstarter campaign or click here . Perks will be delivered by December 2015.
Please keep in mind this is an “all-or-nothing” deal, which means if the campaign does not reach the funding goal then the project cannot move forward. So know that any amount given can make a difference, and this is an incredible opportunity to be a part of a special campaign! Help Eggbro reach the goal by sharing this on Facebook, Twitter, and other social networks. The more people know about this, the more support the campaign will receive.
Michael Yang
